# f5xc_voltstack_site (Resource)

Shape of the App Stack site specification

~> **Note** For more information about this resource, please refer to the [F5 XC API Documentation](https://docs.cloud.f5.com/docs/api/).

## Example Usage

```terraform
resource "f5xc_voltstack_site" "example" {
  name      = "example"
  namespace = "system"

  labels = {
    "env" = "production"
  }
}
```

<!-- schema generated by tfplugindocs -->
## Schema

### Required

- `name` (String) Name of the VoltstackSite. Must be unique within the namespace.
- `namespace` (String) Namespace where the VoltstackSite will be created.

### Optional

- `address` (String) Geographical Address. Site's geographical address that can be used to determine its latitude and longitude. ves.io.schema.rules.string.max_len: 256
- `allow_all_usb` (Block, Optional) Empty. This can be used for messages where no values are needed (see [below for nested schema](#nestedblock--allow_all_usb))
- `annotations` (Map of String) Annotations to apply to this resource.
- `blocked_services` (Block, Optional) Disable Node Local Services. Disable node local services on this site. Note: The chosen services will get disabled on all nodes in the site. (see [below for nested schema](#nestedblock--blocked_services))
- `bond_device_list` (Block, Optional) Bond Devices List. List of bond devices for this fleet (see [below for nested schema](#nestedblock--bond_device_list))
- `coordinates` (Block, Optional) Site Coordinates. Coordinates of the site which provides the site physical location (see [below for nested schema](#nestedblock--coordinates))
- `custom_dns` (Block, Optional) Custom DNS. Custom DNS is the configured for specify CE site (see [below for nested schema](#nestedblock--custom_dns))
- `custom_network_config` (Block, Optional) VssNetworkConfiguration. (see [below for nested schema](#nestedblock--custom_network_config))

- `offline_survivability_mode` (Block, Optional) Offline Survivability Mode. Offline Survivability allows the Site to continue functioning normally without traffic loss during periods of connectivity loss to the Regional Edge (RE) or the Global Controller (GC). When this feature is enabled, a site can continue to function as is with existing configuration for upto 7 days, even when the site is offline. The certificates needed to keep the services running on this site are signed using a local CA. Secrets would also be cached locally to handl... (see [below for nested schema](#nestedblock--offline_survivability_mode))
- `os` (Block, Optional) Operating System Version. Select the F5XC Operating System Version for the site. By default, latest available OS Version will be used. Refer to release notes to find required released OS versions. (see [below for nested schema](#nestedblock--os))
- `sriov_interfaces` (Block, Optional) Custom SR-IOV interfaces Configuration List. List of all custom SR-IOV interfaces configuration (see [below for nested schema](#nestedblock--sriov_interfaces))

- `network_type` (String) Virtual Network Type. Different types of virtual networks understood by the system Virtual-network of type VIRTUAL_NETWORK_SITE_LOCAL provides connectivity to public (outside) network. This is an insecure network and is connected to public internet via NAT Gateways/firwalls Virtual-network of this type is local to every site. Two virtual networks of this type on different sites are neither related nor connected. Constraints: There can be atmost one virtual network of this type in a given site...

<a id="nestedblock--kubernetes_upgrade_drain--enable_upgrade_drain"></a>
### Nested Schema for `kubernetes_upgrade_drain.enable_upgrade_drain`

Optional:

- `disable_vega_upgrade_mode` (Block, Optional) Empty. This can be used for messages where no values are needed (see [below for nested schema](#nestedblock--kubernetes_upgrade_drain--enable_upgrade_drain--disable_vega_upgrade_mode))
- `drain_max_unavailable_node_count` (Number) Node Batch Size Count. Exclusive with [] ves.io.schema.rules.uint32.gte: 1 ves.io.schema.rules.uint32.lte: 5000
- `drain_node_timeout` (Number) Upgrade Wait Time. Seconds to wait before initiating upgrade on the next set of nodes. Setting it to 0 will wait indefinitely for all services on nodes to be upgraded gracefully before proceeding to the next set of nodes. (Warning: It may block upgrade if services on a node cannot be gracefully upgraded. It is recommended to use the default value). Required: YES ves.io.schema.rules.message.required: true ves.io.schema.rules.uint32.gte: 0 ves.io.schema.rules.uint32.lte: 900
- `enable_vega_upgrade_mode` (Block, Optional) Empty. This can be used for messages where no values are needed (see [below for nested schema](#nestedblock--kubernetes_upgrade_drain--enable_upgrade_drain--enable_vega_upgrade_mode))

### Nested Schema for `local_control_plane.bgp_config`

Optional:

- `asn` (Number) ASN. Autonomous System Number Required: YES ves.io.schema.rules.message.required: true ves.io.schema.rules.uint32.gte: 1
- `peers` (Block List) Peers. BGP parameters for peer ves.io.schema.rules.repeated.max_items: 8 ves.io.schema.rules.repeated.unique_metadata_name: true (see [below for nested schema](#nestedblock--local_control_plane--bgp_config--peers))

<a id="nestedblock--local_control_plane--bgp_config--peers"></a>
### Nested Schema for `local_control_plane.bgp_config.peers`

Optional:

- `bfd_disabled` (Block, Optional) Empty. This can be used for messages where no values are needed (see [below for nested schema](#nestedblock--local_control_plane--bgp_config--peers--bfd_disabled))
- `bfd_enabled` (Block, Optional) BFD. BFD parameters. (see [below for nested schema](#nestedblock--local_control_plane--bgp_config--peers--bfd_enabled))
- `disable` (Block, Optional) Empty. This can be used for messages where no values are needed (see [below for nested schema](#nestedblock--local_control_plane--bgp_config--peers--disable))
- `external` (Block, Optional) External BGP Peer. External BGP Peer parameters. (see [below for nested schema](#nestedblock--local_control_plane--bgp_config--peers--external))
- `label` (String) Label. Specify whether this peer should be
- `metadata` (Block, Optional) Message Metadata. MessageMetaType is metadata (common attributes) of a message that only certain messages have. This information is propagated to the metadata of a child object that gets created from the containing message during view processing. The information in this type can be specified by user during create and replace APIs. (see [below for nested schema](#nestedblock--local_control_plane--bgp_config--peers--metadata))
- `passive_mode_disabled` (Block, Optional) Empty. This can be used for messages where no values are needed (see [below for nested schema](#nestedblock--local_control_plane--bgp_config--peers--passive_mode_disabled))
- `passive_mode_enabled` (Block, Optional) Empty. This can be used for messages where no values are needed (see [below for nested schema](#nestedblock--local_control_plane--bgp_config--peers--passive_mode_enabled))
- `routing_policies` (Block, Optional) BGP Routing Policy. List of rules which can be applied on all or particular nodes (see [below for nested schema](#nestedblock--local_control_plane--bgp_config--peers--routing_policies))

## Import

Import is supported using the following syntax:

```shell
# Import using namespace/name format
terraform import f5xc_voltstack_site.example system/example
```
